data.title: Continuing the Traditions of Yesterday and Creating the Legends of Tomorrow™
data.meta_description: Lee Jackson’s early Hot Rodded Marshall’s and Metaltronix Custom Hand Built Amplifiers have became legendary in the Music Industry.
data.meta_site_name: Lee Jackson Metaltronix Amplifiers Marshall Fender Custom Modifications - Continuing the Traditions of Yesterday and Creating the Legends of Tomorrow™
data.text:
Lee Jackson is the founder and CEO of Metaltronix, a visionary in the music industry renowned for crafting signature sounds for some of the biggest names and contributing to the iconic guitar tones of the 80s & 90s. With a prolific career that includes shaping the audio landscapes of albums like “Under Lock n Key” (Dokken), “Invasion of your Privacy” (Ratt), “Eat Em and Smile” (David Lee Roth), and “No Rest for the Wicked” (Ozzy Osbourne), Lee has left an indelible mark on the industry.

Lee’s entrepreneurial spirit led him to establish his own companies, including Metaltronix, Perfect Connection, and Lee Jackson Designs. His expertise extended to collaborations with esteemed companies such as BC Rich Guitars, Paul Rivera, Pignose, Oberheim, Fender, Crate, and Ampeg. Through these collaborations, Lee played a pivotal role in creating industry standards in sound.

Hailing from Southern California, Lee’s upbringing was immersed in music. His parents owned a record store reminiscent of the one in Hairspray, playing classic tunes from the ’50s and ’60s. Introduced to the sounds of the sixties by his two older sisters and inspired by his father’s passion for electronics, Lee’s journey into music and technology began.

Beyond his role as a musician and entrepreneur, Lee Jackson’s legacy is etched in the very fabric of the music industry, influencing generations with his innovative approach to sound and technology.

Latest News:

Metaltronix M-2000 v2 Head

The New Metaltronix M-2000 v2 is now available to purchase. They are in stock, Lee did a special Collectors Edition run of 10, They are extremely special, and will not be made again.

Metallica Metaltronix M-1000

Check out interview with James Hetfield talking about the new Album.

We have been told that they used the M-1000 on 4 songs.

And used Lee’s Ampeg VL-1002 heads also.

CUSTOM AMP MODIFICATION

We get asked every week if Lee still does personal amplifier Modifications and the answer is yes. Lee will custom modify your Marshall or Fender amplifier, as he has done for many famous guitar players around the world.

Contact us asking about your amp, and we will get back to you on the possibilities , costs and Lee’s schedule. More info HERE

PLATINUM DISTORTION

It has ARRIVED the PLATINUM DISTORTION! pedal.

This is the best distortion Lee has designed to date,

It is several different distortion circuits in one pedal.

You can have a variety of sounds from a tube style distortion,

To full on Metal and everything in between. More Info Here

“THE PRE” Studio Mic Pre Amp

And our New 500 series Studio Preamp is done and sounds amazing, It is called “THE PRE” it is a tremendous amount of joy packed in a small package. In its first week of release it is loved by many. More Info Here

“The Pre is just awesome, that is all I can say” Kelly Donelly – Eric Johnson engineer

BIG 1 Pedal

Our pedal the BIG1 is getting a lot of attention:

“The BIG 1 pedal has quickly become a staple of my live set up. This is one of the most insanely useful pedals I’ve ever encountered – it essentially adds warmth and top end to the sound, all in a unified way, revealing what is coming from the guitar without ever feeling overly hyped. I am so fond of this pedal because it highlights and brings forth so much of what I love about the electric guitar, namely overtones and a wide dynamic range. Regardless of what amp I use the BIG with, it seems to function almost like the mastering stage of an album – it is subtle and instantly musical, and when its not there, you sure miss it!” – Julian Lage

TONETALK

I had a blast on Tonetalk, I am glad they invited me on. It was great talking about the 80’s and the bands I was involved with. See the complete show HERE

Merchandise Store

We now have a Merchandise Store, we now can make you our shirts in every size. Plus now we are able to offer our popular Metaltronix and Lee Jackson Coffee Mugs again.
